title: 112_s3531
content: Expansion of credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property. Expansion of credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property, including an increase in the credit percentage to 50% for hydrogen-related property and the removal of the dollar limitation for hydrogen-related property. Additionally, the credit is allowable for refueling property for certain motor vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads. The amendment allows for a credit for refueling property for certain motor vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads, specifically for off-highway vehicles with hydrogen fuel storage or dispensing capabilities. The amendment allows for a credit for refueling property for off-highway vehicles with hydrogen fuel storage or dispensing capabilities, regardless of the type of motor propulsion. The term "motor" refers to vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads, excluding farm tractors and similar equipment that do not carry loads. The credit for hydrogen property has been extended through 2016, and the amendments apply to property placed in service after the enactment date in taxable years ending after that date. The amendments to the hydrogen property credit apply to property placed in service after the enactment date in taxable years ending after that date. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells, with a 50 percent increase for qualified fuel cell property used in a combined heat and power system with an energy efficiency percentage of 70 percent or more. The power system must have an energy efficiency percentage of 70 percent or more, or 40 percent for qualified fuel cell property with an energy efficiency percentage of at least 60 percent but less than 70 percent. Conforming amendments are also made to the Code. Conforming amendments are made to the Code regarding the maximum credit for qualified fuel cell property. Increased Maximum Credit for qualified fuel cell property under section 48(c)(1)(B) of the Code is amended to limit the credit to $2,500 for each 0.5 kilowatt of capacity for property placed in service during the taxable year. The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
